articles.headline: Obama Denounces Donald Trump for His ‘Dangerous’ Mind-Set
articles.snippet: The president said Mr. Trump’s remarks after the mass shooting in Orlando, Fla., recalled the most shameful periods in American history.
articles.abstract: The president said Mr. Trump’s remarks after the mass shooting in Orlando, Fla., recalled the most shameful periods in American history.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama angrily denounced Donald J. Trump on Tuesday for his remarks in the aftermath of the shooting massacre in Orlando, Fla., warning that Mr. Trump, the presumptive Republican presidential nominee, was peddling a “dangerous” mind-set that recalled the darkest and most shameful periods in American history.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Donald Trump Responds to Orlando Attack by Exploiting Fear, Not Easing It
articles.snippet: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises.
articles.abstract: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was one of George W. Bush’s most viscerally powerful commercials against John Kerry in the 2004 presidential race: a pack of wolves lurking in a forest as a narrator accused Mr. Kerry of slashing intelligence gathering against terrorists. “Weakness attracts those who are waiting to do America harm,” the ad warned, as the wolves started running toward the camera.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: After F.B.I.’s Inquiry Into Omar Mateen, a Focus on What Else Could Be Done
articles.snippet: The nightclub shooting in Orlando, Fla., has focused unusual attention on the mundane process of investigating thousands of people accused of terrorist ties.
articles.abstract: The nightclub shooting in Orlando, Fla., has focused unusual attention on the mundane process of investigating thousands of people accused of terrorist ties.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Every day, in F.B.I. offices around the country, agents leaf through classified counterterrorism documents on American citizens one last time. They reread informant reports and review surveillance logs. And then they close the case and walk away.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Eric Lichtblau

articles.headline: For Hillary Clinton, a Risk of Excess Caution in Economic Policy
articles.snippet: Some of the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee’s proposals could help lift employment, but her focus seems to be anachronistic.
articles.abstract: Some of the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee’s proposals could help lift employment, but her focus seems to be anachronistic.

articles.headline: MSCI Delays Adding China Stock to Emerging Markets Benchmark
articles.snippet: The index provider’s decision to once again postpone the inclusion of mainland stocks in its influential benchmark reflected continuing concerns over Chinese government intervention.
articles.abstract: The index provider’s decision to once again postpone the inclusion of mainland stocks in its influential benchmark reflected continuing concerns over Chinese government intervention.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Chinese stocks had seemed poised to join an important global benchmark, paving the way for overseas money to pour into the country’s markets.
articles.byline: By Neil Gough and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: In Revoking Press Credentials, Trump Casts Himself as Punisher in Chief
articles.snippet: The presumptive Republican nominee defended his campaign’s ban of several press organizations, saying he was reacting to “dishonest” coverage.
articles.abstract: The presumptive Republican nominee defended his campaign’s ban of several press organizations, saying he was reacting to “dishonest” coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: You never know what’s going to cause Donald J. Trump to officially ban a news organization from his presidential campaign events.

articles.headline: ‘Brexit’ Plan for the Financial World? Cross Your Fingers
articles.snippet: As the odds increase that Britain will leave the European Union, major banks and policy makers are trying to plan for potential market panic.
articles.abstract: As the odds increase that Britain will leave the European Union, major banks and policy makers are trying to plan for potential market panic.
articles.lead_paragraph: Among those who manage gobs of money, the possibility that Britain might actually disavow the European Union seemed until recently like a remote and even outlandish possibility.

articles.headline: Control and Fear: What Mass Killings and Domestic Violence Have in Common
articles.snippet: Research by social scientists reveals striking parallels between what drives the two violent phenomena.
articles.abstract: Research by social scientists reveals striking parallels between what drives the two violent phenomena.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the first things we learned about Omar Mateen, the gunman in the nightclub massacre in Orlando, Fla., was that his ex-wife said he had beaten her severely until she left him in 2009.
